intro: Eremogone loisiae, commonly known as the mountain dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces yellow ray florets surrounded by a dense cluster of tubular disc florets. It thrives in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to extreme conditions. Eremogone loisiae is often found in alpine meadows and is valued for its resilience and ecological importance in its native habitat.
